title: Foundation in 3D and Programming
description: A background in Maths or Computer Science is ideal. Start by learning the fundamentals of 3D computer graphics and master a core programming language used in game engines, like C# or C++.

title: Master a Real-time 3D Engine
description: Become highly proficient in a game engine like Unity or Unreal Engine, as these are the primary platforms for AR/VR development. Learn how to create scenes, import assets, and write scripts within the engine.
qualifications: Portfolio of projects built in Unity or Unreal

title: Specialize in AR/VR Development
description: Dive into the specific SDKs for AR and VR platforms. Learn how to build and deploy applications for target devices. This is where you move from general 3D development to creating interactive, immersive experiences.
skills: AR SDKs (AR Foundation for Unity, ARCore, ARKit)
Understanding of user interaction in VR (hand tracking, controllers)

title: AR/VR Developer
description: Work for a studio or company that creates AR/VR applications. This could be in gaming, enterprise training, marketing, or real estate visualization. You will be responsible for building and maintaining features for these immersive applications.
qualifications: Experience shipping a commercial AR/VR application
institutes: Local tech companies with R&D/innovation labs

title: Senior AR/VR Engineer / Technical Lead
description: Advance to a senior role where you architect complex AR/VR systems, lead development teams, and tackle the most challenging technical problems in the immersive space. This requires deep, specialized expertise and leadership skills.
qualifications: A portfolio of high-quality, shipped AR/VR titles
skills: Staying current with rapidly evolving hardware
